verses.verse: And <S%G1161><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%>, earnestly beholding <S%G816><s%> <S%G5660><s%> the council <S%G4892><s%>, said <S%G2036><s%> <S%G5627><s%>, Men <S%G435><s%> and brethren <S%G80><s%>, I <S%G1473><s%> have lived <S%G4176><s%> <S%G5769><s%> in all <S%G3956><s%> good <S%G18><s%> conscience <S%G4893><s%> before 'Elohim <S%G2316><s%> until <S%G891><s%> this <S%G5026><s%> day <S%G2250><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> the Kohen HaGodol <S%G749><s%> Halfai <S%G367><s%> commanded <S%G2004><s%> <S%G5656><s%> them that stood by <S%G3936><s%> <S%G5761><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to smite <S%G5180><s%> <S%G5721><s%> him <S%G846><s%> on the mouth <S%G4750><s%>.

Then <S%G5119><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> <S%G5627><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, 'Elohim <S%G2316><s%> shall <S%G3195><s%> <S%G5719><s%> smite <S%G5180><s%> <S%G5721><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%>, thou whited <S%G2867><s%> <S%G5772><s%> wall <S%G5109><s%>: for <S%G2532><s%> sittest <S%G2521><s%> <S%G5736><s%> thou <S%G4771><s%> to judge <S%G2919><s%> <S%G5723><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> after <S%G2596><s%> the Torah <S%G3551><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> commandest <S%G2753><s%> <S%G5719><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> to be smitten <S%G5180><s%> <S%G5745><s%> contrary to the Torah <S%G3891><s%> <S%G5723><s%>?
And <S%G1161><s%> they that stood by <S%G3936><s%> <S%G5761><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> <S%G5627><s%>, Revilest thou <S%G3058><s%> <S%G5719><s%> 'Elohim's <S%G2316><s%> Kohen HaGodol <S%G749><s%>?

Then <S%G5037><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> <S%G5713><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%>, I wist <S%G1492><s%> <S%G5715><s%> not <S%G3756><s%>, brethren <S%G80><s%>, that <S%G3754><s%> he was <S%G2076><s%> <S%G5748><s%> the Kohen HaGodol <S%G749><s%>: for <S%G1063><s%> it is written <S%G1125><s%> <S%G5769><s%>, Thou shalt <S%G2046><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> speak <S%G2046><s%> <S%G5692><s%> evil <S%G2560><s%> of the ruler <S%G758><s%> of thy <S%G4675><s%> people <S%G2992><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> when SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%> perceived <S%G1097><s%> <S%G5631><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> the one <S%G1520><s%> part <S%G3313><s%> were <S%G2076><s%> <S%G5748><s%> TZ'dukim <S%G4523><s%>, and <S%G1161><s%> the other <S%G2087><s%> P'rushim <S%G5330><s%>, he cried out <S%G2896><s%> <S%G5656><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the council <S%G4892><s%>, Men <S%G435><s%> and brethren <S%G80><s%>, I <S%G1473><s%> am <S%G1510><s%> <S%G5748><s%> a Parush <S%G5330><s%>, the son <S%G5207><s%> of a Parush <S%G5330><s%>: of <S%G4012><s%> the hope <S%G1680><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> resurrection <S%G386><s%> of the dead <S%G3498><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> am called in question <S%G2919><s%> <S%G5743><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when he <S%G846><s%> had <S%G2980><s%> so <S%G5124><s%> said <S%G2980><s%> <S%G5660><s%>, there arose <S%G1096><s%> <S%G5633><s%> a dissension <S%G4714><s%> between the P'rushim <S%G5330><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the TZ'dukim <S%G4523><s%>: and <S%G2532><s%> the multitude <S%G4128><s%> was divided <S%G4977><s%> <S%G5681><s%>.

For <S%G1063><s%> <S%G3303><s%> the TZ'dukim <S%G4523><s%> say <S%G3004><s%> <S%G5719><s%> that there is <S%G1511><s%> <S%G5750><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> resurrection <S%G386><s%>, neither <S%G3366><s%> angel <S%G32><s%>, nor <S%G3383><s%> spirit <S%G4151><s%>: but <S%G1161><s%> the P'rushim <S%G5330><s%> confess <S%G3670><s%> <S%G5719><s%> both <S%G297><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> there arose <S%G1096><s%> <S%G5633><s%> a great <S%G3173><s%> cry <S%G2906><s%>: and <S%G2532><s%> the scribes <S%G1122><s%> that were of the P'rushim <S%G5330><s%>' part <S%G3313><s%> arose <S%G450><s%> <S%G5631><s%>, and strove <S%G1264><s%> <S%G5711><s%>, saying <S%G3004><s%> <S%G5723><s%>, We find <S%G2147><s%> <S%G5719><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> evil <S%G2556><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> this <S%G5129><s%> man <S%G444><s%>: but <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> a spirit <S%G4151><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> an angel <S%G32><s%> hath spoken <S%G2980><s%> <S%G5656><s%> to him <S%G846><s%>, let us <S%G2313><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> fight <S%G2313><s%> <S%G5725><s%> against 'Elohim.

And <S%G1161><s%> when there arose <S%G1096><s%> <S%G5637><s%> a great <S%G4183><s%> dissension <S%G4714><s%>, the chief captain <S%G5506><s%>, fearing <S%G2125><s%> <S%G5685><s%> lest <S%G3361><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%> should have been pulled in pieces <S%G1288><s%> <S%G5686><s%> of <S%G5259><s%> them <S%G846><s%>, commanded <S%G2753><s%> <S%G5656><s%> the soldiers <S%G4753><s%> to go down <S%G2597><s%> <S%G5631><s%>, and to take <S%G726><s%> him <S%G846><s%> by force <S%G726><s%> <S%G5658><s%> from <S%G1537><s%> among <S%G3319><s%> them <S%G846><s%>, and <S%G5037><s%> to bring <S%G71><s%> <S%G5721><s%> him into <S%G1519><s%> the castle <S%G3925><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> the night <S%G3571><s%> following <S%G1966><s%> <S%G5752><s%> the YY <S%G2962><s%> stood by <S%G2186><s%> <S%G5631><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, and said <S%G2036><s%> <S%G5627><s%>, Be of good cheer <S%G2293><s%> <S%G5720><s%>, SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%>: for <S%G1063><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> thou hast testified <S%G1263><s%> <S%G5662><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> me <S%G1700><s%> in <S%G1519><s%> Yerushalayim <S%G2419><s%>, so <S%G3779><s%> must <S%G1163><s%> <S%G5748><s%> thou <S%G4571><s%> bear witness <S%G3140><s%> <S%G5658><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Rome <S%G4516><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when it was <S%G1096><s%> <S%G5637><s%> day <S%G2250><s%>, certain <S%G5100><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> banded together <S%G4160><s%> <S%G5660><s%> <S%G4963><s%>, and bound <S%G332><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> under a curse <S%G332><s%> <S%G5656><s%>, saying <S%G3004><s%> <S%G5723><s%> that they would <S%G5315><s%> neither <S%G3383><s%> eat <S%G5315><s%> <S%G5629><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> drink <S%G4095><s%> <S%G5629><s%> till <S%G2193><s%> <S%G3739><s%> they had killed <S%G615><s%> <S%G5725><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> they were <S%G2258><s%> <S%G5713><s%> more than <S%G4119><s%> forty <S%G5062><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> had made <S%G4160><s%> <S%G5761><s%> this <S%G5026><s%> conspiracy <S%G4945><s%>.

And they <S%G3748><s%> came to <S%G4334><s%> <S%G5631><s%> the chief Kohanim <S%G749><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> elders <S%G4245><s%>, and said <S%G2036><s%> <S%G5627><s%>, We have bound <S%G332><s%> <S%G5656><s%> ourselves <S%G1438><s%> under a great curse <S%G331><s%>, that we will eat <S%G1089><s%> <S%G5664><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> <S%G3739><s%> we have slain <S%G615><s%> <S%G5725><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%>.

Now <S%G3568><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> ye <S%G5210><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> the council <S%G4892><s%> signify <S%G1718><s%> <S%G5657><s%> to the chief captain <S%G5506><s%> that <S%G3704><s%> he bring <S%G2609><s%> him <S%G846><s%> down <S%G2609><s%> <S%G5632><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> you <S%G5209><s%> to morrow <S%G839><s%>, as <S%G5613><s%> though ye would <S%G3195><s%> <S%G5723><s%> enquire <S%G1231><s%> <S%G5721><s%> something more perfectly <S%G197><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> him <S%G846><s%>: and <S%G1161><s%> we <S%G2249><s%>, or ever <S%G4253><s%> he <S%G846><s%> come near <S%G1448><s%> <S%G5658><s%>, are <S%G2070><s%> <S%G5748><s%> ready <S%G2092><s%> to kill <S%G337><s%> <S%G5629><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when SHa'ul's <S%G3972><s%> sister's <S%G79><s%> son <S%G5207><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> <S%G5660><s%> of their lying in wait <S%G1749><s%>, he went <S%G3854><s%> <S%G5637><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> entered <S%G1525><s%> <S%G5631><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the castle <S%G3925><s%>, and told <S%G518><s%> <S%G5656><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%>.

Then <S%G1161><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%> called <S%G4341><s%> <S%G5666><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> of the centurions <S%G1543><s%> unto him, and said <S%G5346><s%> <S%G5713><s%>, Bring <S%G520><s%> <S%G5628><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> young man <S%G3494><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> the chief captain <S%G5506><s%>: for <S%G1063><s%> he hath <S%G2192><s%> <S%G5719><s%> a certain thing <S%G5100><s%> to tell <S%G518><s%> <S%G5658><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

So <S%G3767><s%> <S%G3303><s%> he took <S%G3880><s%> <S%G5631><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, and brought <S%G71><s%> <S%G5627><s%> him to <S%G4314><s%> the chief captain <S%G5506><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> <S%G5748><s%>, SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%> the prisoner <S%G1198><s%> called <S%G4341><s%> <S%G5666><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> unto him, and prayed me <S%G2065><s%> <S%G5656><s%> to bring <S%G71><s%> <S%G5629><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> young man <S%G3494><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%>, who hath <S%G2192><s%> <S%G5723><s%> something <S%G5100><s%> to say <S%G2980><s%> <S%G5658><s%> unto thee <S%G4671><s%>.

Then <S%G1161><s%> the chief captain <S%G5506><s%> took <S%G1949><s%> <S%G5637><s%> him <S%G846><s%> by the hand <S%G5495><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> went with him aside <S%G402><s%> <S%G5660><s%> privately <S%G2596><s%> <S%G2398><s%>, and asked <S%G4441><s%> <S%G5711><s%> him, What <S%G5101><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> <S%G5748><s%> that <S%G3739><s%> thou hast <S%G2192><s%> <S%G5719><s%> to tell <S%G518><s%> <S%G5658><s%> me <S%G3427><s%>?

And <S%G1161><s%> he said <S%G2036><s%> <S%G5627><s%>, <S%G3754><s%> The Jews <S%G2453><s%> have agreed <S%G4934><s%> <S%G5639><s%> to desire <S%G2065><s%> <S%G5658><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%> that <S%G3704><s%> thou wouldest bring down <S%G2609><s%> <S%G5632><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%> to morrow <S%G839><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the council <S%G4892><s%>, as <S%G5613><s%> though they would <S%G3195><s%> <S%G5723><s%> enquire <S%G4441><s%> <S%G5738><s%> somewhat <S%G5100><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> him <S%G846><s%> more perfectly <S%G197><s%>.

But <S%G3767><s%> do <S%G3982><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> thou <S%G4771><s%> yield <S%G3982><s%> <S%G5686><s%> unto them <S%G846><s%>: for <S%G1063><s%> there lie in wait for <S%G1748><s%> <S%G5719><s%> him <S%G846><s%> of <S%G1537><s%> them <S%G846><s%> more than <S%G4119><s%> forty <S%G5062><s%> men <S%G435><s%>, which <S%G3748><s%> have bound <S%G332><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> with an oath <S%G332><s%> <S%G5656><s%>, that they will <S%G5315><s%> neither <S%G3383><s%> eat <S%G5315><s%> <S%G5629><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> drink <S%G4095><s%> <S%G5629><s%> till <S%G2193><s%> <S%G3739><s%> they have killed <S%G337><s%> <S%G5661><s%> him <S%G846><s%>: and <S%G2532><s%> now <S%G3568><s%> are they <S%G1526><s%> <S%G5748><s%> ready <S%G2092><s%>, looking for <S%G4327><s%> <S%G5740><s%> a promise <S%G1860><s%> from <S%G575><s%> thee <S%G4675><s%>.

So <S%G3303><s%> <S%G3767><s%> the chief captain <S%G5506><s%> then let <S%G630><s%> the young man <S%G3494><s%> depart <S%G630><s%> <S%G5656><s%>, and charged <S%G3853><s%> <S%G5660><s%> him, See thou tell <S%G1583><s%> <S%G5658><s%> no man <S%G3367><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> thou hast shewed <S%G1718><s%> <S%G5656><s%> these things <S%G5023><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> me <S%G3165><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> he called unto <S%G4341><s%> <S%G5666><s%> him <S%G5100><s%> two <S%G1417><s%> centurions <S%G1543><s%>, saying <S%G2036><s%> <S%G5627><s%>, Make ready <S%G2090><s%> <S%G5657><s%> two hundred <S%G1250><s%> soldiers <S%G4757><s%> to <S%G3704><s%> go <S%G4198><s%> <S%G5680><s%> to <S%G2193><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> horsemen <S%G2460><s%> threescore and ten <S%G1440><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> spearmen <S%G1187><s%> two hundred <S%G1250><s%>, at <S%G575><s%> the third <S%G5154><s%> hour <S%G5610><s%> of the night <S%G3571><s%>;

And <S%G5037><s%> provide <S%G3936><s%> <S%G5658><s%> them beasts <S%G2934><s%>, that <S%G2443><s%> they may set <S%G1913><s%> SHa'ul <S%G3972><s%> on <S%G1913><s%> <S%G5660><s%>, and bring him safe <S%G1295><s%> <S%G5661><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> Felix <S%G5344><s%> the governor <S%G2232><s%>.
And he wrote <S%G1125><s%> <S%G5660><s%> a letter <S%G1992><s%> after <S%G4023><s%> <S%G5723><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> manner <S%G5179><s%>:
Claudius <S%G2804><s%> Lysias <S%G3079><s%> unto the most excellent <S%G2903><s%> governor <S%G2232><s%> Felix <S%G5344><s%> sendeth greeting <S%G5463><s%> <S%G5721><s%>.

This <S%G5126><s%> man <S%G435><s%> was taken <S%G4815><s%> <S%G5685><s%> of <S%G5259><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> should <S%G3195><s%> <S%G5723><s%> have been killed <S%G337><s%> <S%G5745><s%> of <S%G5259><s%> them <S%G846><s%>: then came I <S%G2186><s%> <S%G5631><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> an army <S%G4753><s%>, and rescued <S%G1807><s%> <S%G5639><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, having understood <S%G3129><s%> <S%G5631><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> he was <S%G2076><s%> <S%G5748><s%> a Roman <S%G4514><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when <S%G1014><s%> I would <S%G1014><s%> <S%G5740><s%> have known <S%G1097><s%> <S%G5629><s%> the cause <S%G156><s%> wherefore <S%G1223><s%> <S%G3739><s%> they accused <S%G1458><s%> <S%G5707><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, I brought <S%G2609><s%> him <S%G846><s%> forth <S%G2609><s%> <S%G5627><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> their <S%G846><s%> council <S%G4892><s%>:

Whom <S%G3739><s%> I perceived <S%G2147><s%> <S%G5627><s%> to be accused <S%G1458><s%> <S%G5746><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> questions <S%G2213><s%> of their <S%G846><s%> Torah <S%G3551><s%>, but <S%G1161><s%> to have <S%G2192><s%> <S%G5723><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> laid to his charge <S%G1462><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death <S%G2288><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> of bonds <S%G1199><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when it was told <S%G3377><s%> <S%G5685><s%> me <S%G3427><s%> how that <S%G5259><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> laid wait <S%G1917><s%> <S%G3195><s%> <S%G5721><s%> <S%G1510><s%> <S%G5705><s%> for <S%G1519><s%> the man <S%G435><s%>, I sent <S%G3992><s%> <S%G5656><s%> straightway <S%G1824><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%>, and gave Mitzvah <S%G3853><s%> <S%G5660><s%> to his accusers <S%G2725><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> to say <S%G3004><s%> <S%G5721><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> thee <S%G4675><s%> what they had against <S%G4314><s%> him <S%G846><s%>. Farewell <S%G4517><s%> <S%G5770><s%>.
